Mike Pence shut the door Thursday on seeking the presidency in 2012 but left unanswered whether his choice instead is the Indiana governor's office. I'm open to running for governor, Mike Pence said in an exclusive interview with The Indianapolis Star. "We're going to take the next several months to travel across the state and hear what Hoosiers have to say. We'll seriously consider it.

Whenever you have a caretaker CEO, they're supposed to stay in place until the founders have enough experience, he said. "Larry had enough experience about four years ago."
